name: Ham with Red Eye Gravy
author: Chef John
summary: The way the bitter coffee marries with the sweet, smoky fat is far from unpleasant, and infinitely better than simply pouring the pan drippings over your food.
ingredients: ½ cup chopped fatty ham scraps
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste
directions: Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat
Cook and stir ham scraps until browned, about 5 minutes
Remove to a plate, reserving the grease in the pan
Place ham slices in the pan and cook over medium heat until browned, about 5 minutes on each side
Season both sides with salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper
Remove ham and reserve on a plate
Reduce heat to medium-low and sprinkle flour over the pan drippings
Increase heat to medium-high and pour in coffee into the pan
Cook and stir until combined and thickened
Return ham to the pan to warm through
